right.  When you're dealing with stuff in your homedir, you don't use sudo.  BAsically, you used root to put stuff into your homedir, so now its owned by root.  Do this: sudo chown -R sam:sam /home/sam/pvpgn
that'll change the ownership to those files (and all ones inside of it) back to you.
